definition: to make one's first public performance (of an entertainer etc)/to start one's career

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: Only a surging Kansas City Royals team buoyed my spirits.
sentences.chinese: 只有刚出道不久的堪萨斯皇家棒球队能鼓舞我的精神。

sentences.english: Michael Corleone: When Johnny was starting out, he was signed to a personal service contract with a big bandleader .
sentences.chinese: 强尼刚出道时和一个私人乐队领班签了服务合同。

sentences.english: He understood very well the difficulties that budding young authors might run into.
sentences.chinese: 他非常理年轻作家刚出道时的艰难。

sentences.english: I started way back as a weightlifter.
sentences.chinese: 我出道时是个举重运动员。

sentences.english: When debuting, John-Hoon was the student of the Seoul University odontology department who was the elite in Korea.
sentences.chinese: 出道时，桢勋还是韩国首尔大学齿科专业的优秀学生。

sentences.english: Many of today’s start-ups are trying to follow the same business strategy.
sentences.chinese: 许多刚刚出道的公司也都想复制这一发展策略。

sentences.english: He started out as a standup comedian in Liverpool.
sentences.chinese: 他在利物浦出道时是一个单口喜剧演员。

sentences.english: Do you still remember how did Justin Biber become famous?
sentences.chinese: 还记得贾斯汀是怎么出道的么？

sentences.english: Today is the D-Day for 2PM, the encore concert day.
sentences.chinese: 今天也是他们出道2周年的日子，2周年快乐。

sentences.english: When I was coming up, it was always comparisons to Dr. J.
sentences.chinese: 当我出道后，人们总是那我和J博士相比较。

sentences.english: I thought his appearance and 10 years ago makes a debut when do not have what change.
sentences.chinese: 自己以为他地样子和10年前出道时没什么转变。

definition: to make one's name/to become famous
show business
child star
to be popular/to be in luck/to have good luck/to develop smoothly
to hit the big time
currently popular (of movie stars, singers etc)
to win instant success (idiom)/to become an instant hit
to appear (in a show etc)/an appearance (on stage etc)
singer
performing arts circles/show business
to be a big hit/to be hugely popular
singing stage/music business (esp. pop music)
to play a small role
to make movies/to be a movie actor (or actress)
talent show/talent competition
music circles/music world
